attributes.action: Allow Tier 4 visa applicants use partner/spouse's bank account as proof of funds
attributes.background: Current Tier 4 (General) visa policy does not allow any flexibility regarding proof of money available to support one's studies. Applicants cannot submit their partner/spouse's personal bank statement as evidence. What if they do not have a joint account? What if their parents cannot afford it?
attributes.additional_details: The current policy states that one can ONLY use one's personal/joint/parents' account bank statements or building society statements as proof of money (aka maintenance/funds) available to support one's studies, if one did not receive any official sponsorship or apply for any loan. However, given the fact that some of the applicants are married/in a civil partnership, allowing them to present their partner/spouse's bank statement is arguably rational.

attributes.action: Require a new referendum on EU with minimum 5% majority to be valid.
attributes.background: With new facts that have come to light, so many people voting based in mis-information and lack of detail, and the divided country we now live in, we want a new referendum on leaving the EU with a clear 5% majority. It's too an important decision to accept a 2% lead and a divided country.

attributes.action: Ban, for at least one year, petitions on the EU referendum.
attributes.background: Rerunning debates in Parliament that have been discussed ad nauseum takes up the valuable time of MPs. The country needs to settle after a protracted build up to the recent EU referendum. Forcing further debate in Parliament is negative.

attributes.action: Give Scotland a referendum with option for independence ONLY if UK leaves EU
attributes.background: Many people in Scotland only want independence because the UK is leaving the EU and should be given this explicit option. If results of this referendum show that leaving the EU will lead to breakup of the UK, there should be another UK referendum on leaving EU as leave voters did not know this.
attributes.additional_details: Following the EU leave vote, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon is seeking an independence referendum on grounds that Scottish people do not want to leave EU. However leave voters did not know that Scottish independence was a consequence of their vote. The fairest way to address this is to urgently hold a Scottish referendum which would be binding only if UK continues to leave EU. Then UK should be given second referendum in full knowledge of the consequences of leaving EU.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of hemp oil for medical purpose within the UK.
attributes.background: Scientific facts prove the benifit of this oil..
attributes.additional_details: Rick Simpson  cancer uk. Many other scientific studies.

attributes.action: Have a referendum on whether the citizens of UK want the breakup of the UK.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the prospect that Northern Ireland and Scotland will leave the United Kingdom, and 48 % of people did not want the UK to leave the EU, this historic breakup of the UK should be the subject of a referendum.

attributes.action: EU referendum results CAN NOT be OVERTURNED or PETITIONED against within 4 years
attributes.background: If a referendum result has been won there should not be another referendum called to dispute the original within 4 years.

attributes.action: Re-establish faith in the UK by making all EU regulations UK law before leaving.
attributes.background: The UK must demonstrate to the world that it is a beacon of international collaboration, co-operation and responsibility. We should start by enshrining into UK law all the regulations and agreements that would expire when we leave the EU, so that it takes a change of law to break an agreement.
attributes.additional_details: We need to show that we don't discard our international agreements and responsibilities lightly, while also boosting confidence that things remain as they are now unless Parliament decides otherwise. We should adopt into law a presumption that each of our international commitments will remain in effect unless a new law is passed to revoke it. We don't want to throw out the good rules with the bad, and we should properly debate each rule we want to get rid of, and know which rules will go, when.

attributes.action: Calculate results based on number of registered voters even those who abstain.
attributes.background: The official result of the EU referendum was that 52% voted leave, whereas when the total number of registered voters was taken into account the result was only 37%. Likewise, in the last General Election in at least one area the number of abstainers was greater than the winning candidate's margin.
attributes.additional_details: There is a large portion of the country who choose not to vote as they believe it will make no difference. We the undersigned believe it's time to change the system so that result percentages are calculated using the number of registered voters and not only those who voted. We believe that this will give a more accurate picture of what the citizens of this country want.

attributes.action: Extend existing points immigration rules to non-Common Travel Area nationals
attributes.background: We petition parliament to extend the points based immigration system that applies to non-EU nationals to the citizens of countries outside the Common Travel Area, and make necessary adjustments to the points requirements to ensure an adequate supply of labour to the various sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Common travel area: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/common-travel-area-cta/common-travel-area-cta

Immigration rules that apply to non-EU citizens: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/immigration-rules/immigration-rules-index

attributes.action: Form an Interim Brexit Government to negotiate the UK's extraction from the EU.
attributes.background:
Dissolve the current Government.
Form an Interim Brexit Government (IBG) with no Remain members in it.
No General Election will be held until the final withdrawal from the EU. 
This is to provide stability until extraction from the EU.
IBG must be made up of members of all parties.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM of the IBG must be chosen by the MP's of Westminster only to prevent factionalism from devolved Governments.
Oversight committees to consist equally of Remain and Brexit members and an independent chairman, to provide the checks and balances required in the EU extraction talks.
Inform Scottish and Northern Irish that if, after the final EU extraction process is complete and they still want to hold a referendum then they can hold them then.

attributes.action: Allow the youth (14-17) to vote in larger elections/referendums
attributes.background:
Big decisions affects them as well, and their future should be the prime concern at the heart of future referendums. 
At the end of the day it is there futures on the line and it would be selfish to deny them a vote.
not letting them vote would be scandalous and would cause outrage among them.
attributes.additional_details:
This is backed up by the fact that YouGov's statistics said 18-24 year olds mostly voted to remain. 
Young people are also told to voice their opinion and this would help them alot, whilst also introducing them to politics and wanting to contribute to society.

attributes.action: Honour the Brexit result by repealing s2, European Communities Act 1972, NOW.
attributes.background: In view of another petition demanding that the Brexit result be ignored and another referendum held, we clearly need an alternative one that can be supported by all those who believe in democracy.

attributes.action: Say No to a Norway style deal with the EU!
attributes.background:
A Government based think tank is considering negotiating a Norway Style deal with the EU!

This should not even be considered as it is a watered down version of our past liability with the EU and that is what we overwhelmingly voted to be rid of!
attributes.additional_details:
Norway STILL has free movement of immigrants from the EU. 

Our Commonwealth friends, the rest of the world and indeed Germany has already confirmed that they still want to trade with us, so we make our own deals with what suits us. For 43 years we have been trading with a strait jacket on, imposed on us by Europe in compliance with their many rules and regs that we have now voted to reject.


Please listen to the people that have asked for change and voted us out of the EU, do the right thing and look after the British people first and foremost for a change and help us to achieve our full potential, which is one of power and greatness.

If you agree, please sign the petition.

attributes.action: Ensure the Brexit negotiating team is politically representative
attributes.background: The UK has just voted to leave the EU and after Article 50 is triggered we will have to negotiate the terms of our disengagement within two years. Our current government gained a parliamentary majority with just 37% of the vote. It does not have a mandate to carry out these negotiations on its own.
attributes.additional_details: Requirements of negotiation: The team negotiating our terms of our disengagement from the EU should consist of MPs from all parties. The final terms should only be considered passed if voted for by a super-majority (66%) in parliament. Each constituent nation's administration shall have a veto over the terms.

attributes.action: Allow just THE CAR to be insured, not each individual driver of a car.
attributes.background: Sign the petition to allow just a car to be insured by a person and not have to insure every specific person for a specific car.

attributes.action: Give greater autonomy to Northern England and create a Northern Assembly
attributes.background: The North of England is a diverse and great place and deserves to have the same say about its own laws and futures as places such as Wales and Scotland.

attributes.action: A referendum on whether or not parliament should endorse the Brexit vote
attributes.background: Only 51.9% of the 72% who voted supported the Brexit. The impact of Brexit will be such that the decision should not be left to this 37.368% of the electorate. This is not enough to endorse Brexit alone. An effort has to be made to ensure that a practical plan is made that the public can review.
attributes.additional_details:
This is not calling for another EU referendum. This is calling for a referendum on the consequence of the EU referendum. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36616028

attributes.action: Let 17 year olds vote in a 2nd EU Referendum
attributes.background: The 17 year olds in the UK should also get the chance to vote as it is our future that the older generations are deciding upon. There is a precedent for us to be able to vote, as 16 year olds were allowed to vote in the Scottish Referendum

attributes.action: London should be re-classified as part of Scotland in light of the EU vote.
attributes.background: In light of how the various regions voted in the EU referendum, I propose that London should be re-classified as part of Scotland. Thus enabling us to remain part of the EU if, as is likely, Scotland votes for independence from the UK.
attributes.additional_details: This would enable London's financial markets to still have the benefits of EU membership and would also strengthen the Scottish economy.

attributes.action: London to receive the same treatment as Scotland in a Vote to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
London Voted democratically to stay in with EU. Our businesses, lives and culture thrive on being a world city tolerant and thriving thanks to migration.

We voted IN! But they want to take us OUT. 

Sign this if you believe London deserves the same treatment as Scotland in its future.
attributes.additional_details: It's perfectly reasonable to propose a one country two systems format, that runs successfully in other countries, and allow London its democratic decision.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for all shops and companies using job applicants as free labour
attributes.background: Make it illegal for all shops and companies using job applicants as free labour disguising it as a trial. This is wrong it gives applicants the impression that they have a job when in fact they don't. Anyone who carries out work should be paid

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for disabled toilets/nappy change areas to have a wall hook.
attributes.background: Disabled people and parents of children using nappy change areas carry bags too. Yet hardly any disabled toilets have pegs or hooks on the walls or doors. Why should the user have to put their belongings on a dirty toilet floor? A peg or hook on the wall or back of the door is a simple solution.
attributes.additional_details: I am the parent of an autistic child still in nappies at age 5. I have become increasingly frustrated at having to put my change bag on dirty toilet floors when a peg or hook would be so cheap to supply and install.

attributes.action: Decrease length of employment time needed to qualify for paternity leave.
attributes.background: I hadn't realised until recently how poor paternity rights in this country are. It is unfair and ridiculous that a man needs to have worked 26 weeks, 15 weeks before the due date, at a company in order to simply qualify for 1 week off work to spend time with his child and the mother.
attributes.additional_details: This is completely disproportionate to the amount of time the father gets off work. It is an important time for both parents as they bond with their child, and indeed a difficult time as they both learn to be parents. It is against every idea of fairness and equality, British values, that fathers do not automatically qualify for at least 1 week for paternity. The length of time they have to have worked there simply must be reduced, and for that matter they should be able to apply for more.

attributes.action: we want the government to take control over BHS until a buyer is found.
attributes.background: Lots of people will loose their jobs at no fault of there own, we the HONEST and hard working feel that the government is not doing enough for these people who have dedicated their lives to this company, and as a tax payer I feel like many others that more should be done to safeguard there future

attributes.action: Make schools have Meatless Mondays in order to reduce pollution.
attributes.background: I believe all UK schools should introduce Meatless Mondays in order to reduce the pollution caused by the meat trade and for students to help reduce pollution in a way that also promotes kindness, compassion and respect for other life.

attributes.action: Support Hindu Community Temple of Threat of Closure Retaining Spiritual Heritage
attributes.background:
We the undersigned object to the closure of the VRAJDHAM  HAVELI (TEMPLE) Leicester, as a consequence of the Priest not being able to perform religious duties.

We call upon the Home Office to reinstate VSUK's sponsorship license immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a heartfelt appeal to stop violation of our Hindu religious freedom and abuse of racial tolerance.

Without this reinstatement the significance would be:
 
A) The Vrajdham Haveli (Temple) will be forced to close down
B) The deity (Lord Krishna) will have to return back to India
C) An irrecoverable loss to the Hindu community, culture, sentiment and beliefs
D) A destruction of a thriving national community centre

attributes.action: Make it illegal for companies to make unsolicited phone calls selling services.
attributes.background: Enough is enough. Constant daily calls both on landline and mobile regarding PPI, accident claim or financial services etc. Also in text form. There should be heavy penalties to stop them as I believe this practice is an invasion of privacy and morally reprehensible.
attributes.additional_details: I have now 'blocked' over 50 telephone numbers on my iPhone but they still keep coming.

attributes.action: More Gender Identity Clinics. Train up doctors and use local practices.
attributes.background: We need more Gender Identity Clinics and more trained doctors so that all Trans patients get quicker service. The longer the waiting time, the more suicides we'll see...

attributes.action: Allow dividends paid to a Sipp in drawdown to be withdrawn tax free up to limit.
attributes.background: Dividends from shares are now tax free up to £5,000 pa. As a Sipp holder, soon to be in drawdown, I have realised that dividends paid to the Sipp, then withdrawn by the pension holder, will be taxed at marginal rate. Pensioners should have the option to withdraw dividends up to £5,000 pa tax free.

attributes.action: Ban the use of non-rewirable (moulded) plugs on electrical appliances.
attributes.background:
Non-rewirable plugs cannot be re-used once the appliance they are attached to is discarded. This adds to land-fill as otherwise reusable plugs are discarded with non-working appliances (fridges, kettles etc.).
Additionally, non-rewirable plugs are more hazardous to children than rewirable plugs.
attributes.additional_details:
Because non-rewirable plugs are very difficult to remove from the cables to which they are attached, they are more likely to be left on discarded cable, posing a risk to children (See: http://www.fatallyflawed.org.uk/html/other_dangers.html).

Over six million electrical items are thrown away every year in the UK (http://www.recycle-more.co.uk/pwpcontrol.php?pwpID=12809). If half of these items had non-rewirable plugs, that's three million usable plugs being discarded yearly in the UK.

attributes.action: Overhaul the democratic system to get leaders to care about the future
attributes.background: The problem: Democracy in it's current format does not create an atmosphere where politicians need to care about the future and most voters are easily manipulated and selfish so also do not care about the future.
attributes.additional_details:
The solution:
Elect a sole leader by means of "Range voting".

This leader will stay in control of the country until 
A) They retire
B) They get under 25% votes in an 'in/out' vote held annually. 
Then we elect a new one. 

Then they will be answerable to the people still but will have the ability to create long term plans and visions for making our country great again. 

Note: Range voting is scoring the candidates 1, 2, ... In the order you prefer them. You don't have to give all a number.

attributes.action: Require a referendum before any decision on the privatisation of public services
attributes.background: In recent times the Post Office has been sold to private ownership and it would seem that the NHS is being sold in small increments currently. All of this happens without the confirmation of the UK voting population. A referendum would, at the least, raise a large amount of awareness to the public.

attributes.action: Reward home working - provide direct tax relief to both employees and employers
attributes.background: Home working is the magic bullet that could solve numerous problems in one. Though it is a current reality for many, home working must be incentivised to drive participation and adoption.
attributes.additional_details:
Home working delivers:

- enormous reduction in individual and institutional carbon footprint
- Increased time employees have with families, loved ones and friends
- eliminates financial costs of commuting to Reduces traffic on UK's roads by up to 40-50%
- Ditto for public transport

I propose:

- direct monthly tax break for employees, pro rata'd by number of non-commuting days (reportedly employer)
- tax break for companies to drive adoption
- subsidisation of setup costs

attributes.action: Abolish financial transitions by cheque between businesses
attributes.background: After having a car stolen the insurance company sent a cheque to the finance company, so instead of a transaction being made on the same day it has taken two weeks. Businesses must always make electronic transactions. In addition to this helping consumers it would also be environmentally friendly.

attributes.action: Amend unfair and harsh legislation against first time fare dodgers.
attributes.background: Many of us have done it by accident at least once in our life. However, getting caught even once now without a ticket on the London Underground can result in a criminal record and ruin the prospects an individual for life! Please help us put an end to this malicious prosecution by the TFL!
attributes.additional_details: Outdated legislation such as Regulation of Railways Act 1889 (Yes this legislation is over 100 years old.) is having a devastating impact on the futures of many people. Most individuals caught and prosecuted are teenagers with no past criminal history who then branded criminal for this minor offence! Transport for London are using this legislation to bully and scare people into settling for huge amounts of money outside of court instead of having a fair trial! Help us change this!

attributes.action: If you pay the TV licence fee you should be able to watch UK TV abroad.
attributes.background: In the UK we pay a licence fee to watch TV, but when you go abroad you cannot watch any UK TV on apps like Iplayer, demand 5 etc.
attributes.additional_details: We are now told that to be able to watch BBC Iplayer we will need to pay the license fee. Therefore on that basis we should be able to watch any UK TV content whilst travelling abroad.

attributes.action: Please Reform The Year 6 SATs
attributes.background:
Last night my son was violently sick, this wasn't from illness, but from the stress of the SATs.
I've seen a massive change in his usual behaviour regardless of my comfort and reassurance. I would like the testing to be spread out over the last term, not crammed into one week.
attributes.additional_details:
The SATs Timetable
Monday 9 May 2016-Key stage 2 English reading test, reading booklet and associated answer booklet.
Tuesday 10 2016- Key stage 2 English grammar, punctuation and spelling test, Paper 1, short answer questions. Key stage 2 English grammar, punctuation and spelling test, Paper 2, spelling.
Wednesday 11 May 2016-Key stage 2 mathematics, Paper 1 arithmetic test. Key stage 2 mathematics, Paper 2 reasoning.
Thursday 12 May 2016	Key stage 2 mathematics, Paper 3, reasoning

attributes.action: Introduce new legislation to ban sexist adverts.
attributes.background:
There is currently a double standard in adverts for what is and isn't considered sexist for men and women.

In many adverts men are mocked, ridiculed, sexualized/objectified in ways that would be completely unacceptable if the sexes were reversed.

Let's have some equality.
attributes.additional_details:
See example adverts: http://sexistads.org/#ads

There is a repeated message in adverts that men are stupid, inferior, sex objects and that their role is purely to serve women. This stereotype is sexist and damaging young men and boys.

These adverts would be completely unacceptable if the sexes were reversed. What's good for the goose is good for the gander.

We propose: a "would this be offensive if we changed the ['sex', 'race', 'age', 'religion']?" test to be applied to all adverts.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a company to require men to wear a neck tie at work
attributes.background: It's still legal in the UK for a company to require male members of staff to wear neck ties at work against their will. Dress code laws should be changed so that men have the option to wear neck ties at work, if they wish. Current formal work dress codes are out-dated and sexist.

attributes.action: Start publishing summaries of protest messages written on voting papers
attributes.background: Writing a message on a ballot paper is seen by many as a legitimate means to protest or to air a view. Such messages are written as part of the democratic process with the intention of being read and therefore should be published after elections as a matter of course.

attributes.action: Make horse ownership illegal
attributes.background: Horse ownership is slavery: a cruel, unnecessary practice that puts each and every horse through unimaginable horrors and humiliation. Horses were born to roam free on wild, open fields, but they have been captured and broken in for generations, with no reprieve. Help us end this monstrous cruelty!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.peta.org/about-peta/faq/how-does-peta-feel-about-horseback-riding/

http://www.peta.org/issues/animals-in-entertainment/animals-used-entertainment-factsheets/charreada-bone-breaking-cruelty/

attributes.action: Mass build affordable homes to rent or buy. People can't afford to live!
attributes.background: House prices have increased to such a degree that even if you are approved for a mortgage, a moderate increase in interest rates will result in crippling poverty. For many a mortgage is impossible. Rent increases faster than wages. Isn't it time to address this problem?

attributes.action: Remove London's status as our capital city and move parliament out of London
attributes.background: The purpose of a capital city is to represent our country and its principles, yet London has enjoyed benefits which the rest of the UK has not had (see evidence). Creating a new capital and moving parliament away from London's influence would make it listen to the people it was made to represent.
attributes.additional_details:
Nationalised transport: http://goo.gl/RkcCRH
London's growth: http://goo.gl/dYnaey
Local museums: http://goo.gl/jUJ6ZG
Allowed corruption: http://goo.gl/7axI00

attributes.action: Make it illegal for job advertisements to omit salary and benefits.
attributes.background:
The gender pay gap is a big, and unnecessary, issue  

In the interest of consistency, equality and fairness making it mandatory to enumerate salary and benefits on any job advertisement   would make it clear internally and externally that a company is committed to transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/mar/07/gender-pay-gap-uk-women-earn-300000-less-men-lifetime

http://www.ons.gov.uk/employmentandlabourmarket/peopleinwork/earningsandworkinghours/bulletins/annualsurveyofhoursandearnings/2015provisionalresults#main-points

Even if this 

http://uk.businessinsider.com/statistics-on-the-gender-pay-gap-for-men-and-women-2016-3

is substantially correct publishing salaries on adverts is hardly going to hinder gender equality.

attributes.action: New Members of Parliament shall be elected by British citizens living overseas.
attributes.background: Millions of British citizens who live and work outside the country are unable to vote in national elections and hence are deprived of representation in parliament. New Members of Parliament shall be elected by, and will represent, these citizens.
attributes.additional_details: The right to vote and be represented in parliament is a fundamental privilege of citizenship, not of residency. Millions of lifelong citizens of Britain only are currently barred from voting in national elections even while individuals with dual citizenship and new citizens may vote. This anomaly shall be remedied by welcoming new Members of Parliament elected solely by those British citizens living overseas who are unable to vote in a geographic constituency.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS sharing patient records with third parties (e.g. Google).
attributes.background:
Patient records are confidential and should be available only to patients and healthcare professionals directly involved in their care.
Allowing access by third parties could, and almost certainly will, lead to improper use by insurance companies and marketing agencies.
attributes.additional_details: Sharing a patient's medical record with a third party should require specific authorisation by the patient.

attributes.action: Select the Taxpayers Alliance to oversee Parliamentary expenses
attributes.background: As we know IPSA has not had a good record in cracking down on fraud in the Houses of Commons and Lords many time we see the political elite getting away with expenses that ordinary people have to pay for in everyday life.
attributes.additional_details: Expenses should only be for paying staff, Office equipment, and in some cases travel not for paying off mortgages on second homes, meals, etc

attributes.action: Spend more money on public services rather than spending it on the military.
attributes.background: 2% of our GDP is spent on our military, a statistic from 2014, that figure has gone done by 0.3% over the last 4 years but our GDP has been rising, meaning more is spent on the military, but public services like the NHS and the police force spending is decreasing.We want more money spent on services
attributes.additional_details: whilst our military spending rises due to our warmongering and being a puppet state to america our public services are getting no extra funding. for the last couple of years the government said that they will fix the NHS and increase the police force but they have done they have done is decrease the spending. The north welsh armed police have to help Cheshire to cut costs because they don't get enough funding. Only 3000 police were at hand to stop the riot in London 2011,an entire city to cover.

attributes.action: Make may 2nd a national holiday to mark Leicester city's title win
attributes.background: On the 2014/15 season Leicester just missed relegation, on the 2015/16 won the premier league with odds of 5000/1. As one of the greatest sporting shocks of modern football, may 2nd should be made a holiday
